TITLE_AND_VERSION_INFO: Sorcery: Dreams of the Mad Overlord
MAIN_MENU_TITLE_2: Sorcery, Dreams of the Mad Overlord
CONFIRM_LEAVE_GAME_OPTIONS: Are you sure you want to cancel your changes and return to the Menu?
CONFIRM_MESSAGE: Are you really sure you want to do this?
CONFIRM_QUIT_MESSAGE: Are you sure you want to Quit?
CONFIRM_SAVE_GAME_OPTIONS: Are you sure you want to Save your changes and return to the Menu?
CONFIRM_SWITCH_ON_STRICT_MODE: Switching on Strict Mode changes many Game Options - the game will be MUCH more difficult in Strict Mode
EXPLAIN_CONFIG_AUTO_SAVE: Game Status/Progress saved to disk after every move/encounter
EXPLAIN_CONFIG_CHEAT_MODE: Enable Wizard/Chat Mode and Avoid Permanent Character Death
EXPLAIN_CONFIG_DICE_ROLLS: Show all internal Dice Rolls and Game Mechanics
EXPLAIN_CONFIG_STRICT_MODE: All gameplay options emulate the original Wizardry I, II, and III Games
EXPLAIN_GAME_AGING_CLASS_CHANGE: Characters ages a number of years when changing Class Change
EXPLAIN_GAME_ALLOW_AMBUSH_HIDE: Allow Thieves and Ninjas to Hide and Ambush in Combat (from Wizardry V)
EXPLAIN_GAME_ALLOW_MIXED_ALIGNMENT: Ignore all alignment restrictions when forming Adventuring Parties
EXPLAIN_GAME_ALLOW_RANGED_WEAPONS: Allow Characters to buy, sell, equip, and use Ranged Weaponry (from Wizardry V)
EXPLAIN_GAME_BATCH_HEALING_AFTER_RETURN: Automatically cast as many Healing Spells as needed on returning to Base to restore all lost Hit Points
EXPLAIN_GAME_REROLL_HIT_POINTS: Reroll all Hit Dice when gaining a level (can often result in +1 hp when gaining a level)
EXPLAIN_GAME_REROLL_ONES: Low dice rolls on Healing Spells (such as 1s or 2s) will be rerolled as needed
EXPLAIN_GAME_SPELL_CASTING_SURPRISE_ROUN: Allow Characters to cast Spells in the Combat Surprise Round when they have a Surprise Round at the beginning of an Encounter
EXPLAIN_GAME_STAT_LOSS_LEVEL_GAIN: Allow a chance of Character Stats to drop when gaining a level
EXPLAIN_GAME_STAT_RESET_CLASS_CHANGE: When changing class, reset Character Stats to racial minimums
EXPLAIN_GRAPHICS_ENCOUNTERS: Show Incoming encounters in the Dungeon
EXPLAIN_GRAPHICS_PROGRESS: Show Explored tiles in the Map
EXPLAIN_GRAPHICS_TELEPORTERS: Show Nearby teleporters in the Dungeon
EXPLAIN_GRAPHICS_TEXTURES: Show Wall/Floor/Ceiling Textures and Dungeon Features
EXPLAIN_GRAPHICS_TRAPS: Show Nearby traps in the Dungeon
EXPLAIN_GRAPHICS_WIREFRAME: Emulate the Wireframe Graphics of the original Games
GAME_BATCH_HEALING_AFTER_RETURN: Automated Healing after Returning to Base
GAME_REROLL_HIT_POINTS: Reroll all Hit Dice on Level Gain
GAME_STAT_LOSS_LEVEL_GAIN: Allow Stat Loss on Level Gain

HELP_INFO:
Supported Command Line Parameters:

Options that don't start the game:

    --help          Display list of command line parameters (this info)

Options that can be applied to start and modify the game:

    --silent        Don't write any information to the console
    --fullscreen    Start the game in full screen mode (the default mode is windowed)
